DataElement.preferredName: Quantitative Result Epstein-Barr Virus Viral Load Measurement Blood Laboratory Procedure Performed Integer::0 Decimal Place Copies per Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of quantitative Epstein-Barr virus viral load of blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Quantitative Result Epstein-Barr Virus Viral Load Measurement Blood Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An outcome or conclusion that can be arrived at by measurement._The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr virus viral load present in a sample._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: An outcome or conclusion that can be arrived at by measurement.
The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr virus viral load present in a sample.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::0 Decimal Place Copies per Milliliter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit of concentration expressed as a number of copies per unit volume equal to one milliliter._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::0 Decimal Place Copies per Milliliter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit of concentration expressed as a number of copies per unit volume equal to one milliliter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A unit of concentration expressed as a number of copies per unit volume equal to one milliliter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
